summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 forwarding voicemails from an unnamed individual in Australia to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The caller claims to be a prisoner, references crimes against her, and names several high-profile figures including Jeffrey Epstein, Lisa Marie Presley, the British Royal Family, and President Trump. The office notes they will block the number and take no further action due to the international nature of the call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by an anonymous caller from Australia who claims to be a prisoner discussing crimes and references Epstein among other high-profile names.

persons.name: Lisa Marie Presley

events.title: Voicemails received from Australian caller
events.description: Three voicemails were received from an unnamed individual in Australia claiming to be a prisoner, discussing crimes committed against her, and referencing high-profile figures including Jeffrey Epstein, Lisa Marie Presley, the British Royal Family, and President Trump.

keyFacts: In August 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office for SDNY received voicemails from an anonymous individual in Australia claiming to be a prisoner and referencing crimes.
The caller specifically named Jeffrey Epstein, Lisa Marie Presley, the British Royal Family, and President Trump in her messages.
The U.S. Attorney's Office decided to block the caller's number and take no further action due to the international nature of the call and considerations of 'international comity'.
The document shows the office's protocol for handling unsolicited, international tips or claims related to high-profile cases.
The identity of the caller is not disclosed in the document; she is only described as a woman in Australia who knows a specific individual 'by name'.
